WorkItem.Description:
Using the latest development source, I was doing the folloing:
* add a few vertices to a polygon p
* perform p.Triangulate
* add another vertex to p
* perform p.Triangulate again

This currently fails with:

```
ArgumentException: An element with the same key already exists in the dictionary.
System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.Int32,TriangleNet.Geometry.Vertex].Add (Int32 key, TriangleNet.Geometry.Vertex value) (at /Users/builduser/buildslave/mono-runtime-and-classlibs/build/mcs/class/corlib/System.Collections.Generic/Dictionary.cs:404)
TriangleNet.Mesh.TransferNodes (IList`1 points) (at Assets/scripts/Triangle/Mesh.cs:446)
TriangleNet.Meshing.Algorithm.Dwyer.Triangulate (IList`1 points) (at Assets/scripts/Triangle/Meshing/Algorithm/Dwyer.cs:79)
TriangleNet.Meshing.GenericMesher.Triangulate (IPolygon polygon, TriangleNet.Meshing.ConstraintOptions options, TriangleNet.Meshing.QualityOptions quality) (at Assets/scripts/Triangle/Meshing/GenericMesher.cs:68)
TriangleNet.Geometry.ExtensionMethods.Triangulate (IPolygon polygon, TriangleNet.Meshing.ConstraintOptions options, TriangleNet.Meshing.QualityOptions quality) (at Assets/scripts/Triangle/Geometry/ExtensionMethods.cs:43)
DelauneyTest.Update () (at Assets/scripts/DelauneyTest.cs:57)
```

I guess the reason is related to the "userId" heuristic in Mesh.cs line 427. As a crude work-around I now enforce userId = false. Maybe the Polygon class should have a "ResetVertexIDs" method? In general it is a bit ugly that triangulate has a side effect on the input data.
WorkItem.Summary: re-running triangulation on modified polygon fails
